title: Ammonia synthesis from nitrogen and steam using electrochemical cells with a hydrogen-permeable membrane and Ru/Cs+/C catalysts
content:
Sustainable Energy Fuels, 2024, 8,914-926
DOI: 10.1039/D3SE01527K, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Shintaroh Nagaishi, Rika Hayashi, Aika Hirata, Raisei Sagara, Jun Kubota
A new electrochemical cell with a hydrogen-permeable membrane, carbon-supported Ru catalysts, and CsH2PO4/SiP2O7 electrolytes synthesizes NH3 from N2 and steam at 10 mA cm−2, 250 °C, and 1.0 MPa with an impressive 28% current efficiency, marking a significant leap in sustainable ammonia production.
